1. X ~ Binom(n = 7, p = .6)
a. Plot
```{r}
p <- .6
n <- 7
X <- 0:7
pX <- dbinom(X, n, p)
plot(X, pX, pch = 19, main = 'X ~ Binom(n = 7, p = .6)', xlab = 'x', ylab = 'P(X=x)')
```

b. Mean of X:
```{r}
EX <- sum(X * pX)
print(EX)
print(c('Alternatively: n*p = ', n*p))
```

c. Support of X: {0, 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7}


2. X ~ exp(lambda = 1/100)
a. Plot
```{r}
lambda <- 1/100
X <- seq(0,1000, length.out = 1001)
fX <- dexp(X, rate = lambda)
plot(X, fX, type = 'l', main = 'X ~ exp(lambda = 1/100)', xlab = 'x', ylab = 'density')
```

b. Support of X is (0,infiniti)


3. Y ~ N(mu = 20, var = 16)
a. sd(Y) = 4
b. P(Y < 28.4)
```{r}
mu <- 20
sdev <- 4
pnorm(28.4, mu, sdev)
```

c. P(Y > 14)
```{r}
1 - pnorm(14, mu, sdev)
```

d. P(17.4 < Y ≤ 23.9)
```{r}
pnorm(23.9, mu, sdev) - pnorm(17.4, mu, sdev)
```

e. 25th Percentile
```{r}
qnorm(.25, mu, sdev)
```

f. The probability density at the distribution’s mode (i.e., what is f(20), because’s the distribution’s peak
is at the value y = 20).
```{r}
dnorm(20, mu, sdev)
```
